segment.source: Create and deploy a VPN policy for enterprise data protection (EDP) using Microsoft Intune (Windows 10)
segment.target: Create and deploy a VPN policy for enterprise data protection (EDP) using Microsoft Intune (Windows 10)

segment.source: After you've created and deployed your enterprise data protection (EDP) policy, you can use Microsoft Intune to create and deploy your Virtual Private Network (VPN) policy, linking it to your EDP policy.
segment.target: After you've created and deployed your enterprise data protection (EDP) policy, you can use Microsoft Intune to create and deploy your Virtual Private Network (VPN) policy, linking it to your EDP policy.

segment.source: Create and deploy a VPN policy for enterprise data protection (EDP) using Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Create and deploy a VPN policy for enterprise data protection (EDP) using Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile Preview
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile Preview

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product, which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product, which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: After you've created and deployed your enterprise data protection (EDP) policy, you can use Microsoft Intune to create and deploy your Virtual Private Network (VPN) policy, linking it to your EDP policy.
segment.target: After you've created and deployed your enterprise data protection (EDP) policy, you can use Microsoft Intune to create and deploy your Virtual Private Network (VPN) policy, linking it to your EDP policy.

segment.source: Create your VPN policy using Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Create your VPN policy using Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Follow these steps to create the VPN policy you want to use with EDP.
segment.target: Follow these steps to create the VPN policy you want to use with EDP.

segment.source: To create your VPN policy
segment.target: To create your VPN policy

segment.source: Open the Intune administration console, and go to the Policy node, and then click Add Policy.
segment.target: Open the Intune administration console, and go to the Policy node, and then click Add Policy.

segment.source: Go to Windows, click the VPN Profile (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later), click Create and Deploy a Custom Policy, and then click Create Policy.
segment.target: Go to Windows, click the VPN Profile (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later), click Create and Deploy a Custom Policy, and then click Create Policy.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune: Create a new policy using the New Policy screen
segment.target: Microsoft Intune: Create a new policy using the New Policy screen

segment.source: Type EdpModeID into the Name box, along with an optional description for your policy into the Description box.
segment.target: Type EdpModeID into the Name box, along with an optional description for your policy into the Description box.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune: Fill in the required Name and optional Description for your policy
segment.target: Microsoft Intune: Fill in the required Name and optional Description for your policy

segment.source: In the VPN Settings area, type the following info:
segment.target: In the VPN Settings area, type the following info:

segment.source: VPN connection name.
segment.target: VPN connection name.

segment.source: This name is also what appears to your employees, so it's important that it be clear and understandable.
segment.target: This name is also what appears to your employees, so it's important that it be clear and understandable.

segment.source: Connection type.
segment.target: Connection type.

segment.source: Pick the connection type that matches your infrastructure.
segment.target: Pick the connection type that matches your infrastructure.

segment.source: The options are Pulse Secure, F5 Edge Client, Dell SonicWALL Mobile Connect, or Check Point Capsule VPN.
segment.target: The options are Pulse Secure, F5 Edge Client, Dell SonicWALL Mobile Connect, or Check Point Capsule VPN.

segment.source: VPN server description.
segment.target: VPN server description.

segment.source: A descriptive name for this connection.
segment.target: A descriptive name for this connection.

segment.source: Only you will see it, but it should be unique and readable.
segment.target: Only you will see it, but it should be unique and readable.

segment.source: Server IP address or FQDN.
segment.target: Server IP address or FQDN.

segment.source: The server's IP address or fully-qualified domain name (FQDN).
segment.target: The server's IP address or fully-qualified domain name (FQDN).

segment.source: Microsoft Intune: Fill in the VPN Settings area
segment.target: Microsoft Intune: Fill in the VPN Settings area

segment.source: In the Authentication area, choose the authentication method that matches your VPN infrastructure, either Username and Password or Certificates.
segment.target: In the Authentication area, choose the authentication method that matches your VPN infrastructure, either Username and Password or Certificates.

segment.source: It's your choice whether you check the box to Remember the user credentials at each logon.
segment.target: It's your choice whether you check the box to Remember the user credentials at each logon.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune: Choose the Authentication Method for your VPN system
segment.target: Microsoft Intune: Choose the Authentication Method for your VPN system

segment.source: You can leave the rest of the default or blank settings, and then click Save Policy.
segment.target: You can leave the rest of the default or blank settings, and then click Save Policy.

segment.source: Deploy your VPN policy using Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Deploy your VPN policy using Microsoft Intune

segment.source: After you’ve created your VPN policy, you'll need to deploy it to the same group you deployed your enterprise data protection (EDP) policy.
segment.target: After you’ve created your VPN policy, you'll need to deploy it to the same group you deployed your enterprise data protection (EDP) policy.

segment.source: To deploy your VPN policy
segment.target: To deploy your VPN policy

segment.source: On the Configuration policies page, locate your newly-created policy, click to select it, and then click the Manage Deployment button.
segment.target: On the Configuration policies page, locate your newly-created policy, click to select it, and then click the Manage Deployment button.

segment.source: In the left pane of the Manage Deployment box, click the employees or groups that should get the policy, and then click Add.
segment.target: In the left pane of the Manage Deployment box, click the employees or groups that should get the policy, and then click Add.

segment.source: The added people move to the Selected Groups list on the right-hand pane.
segment.target: The added people move to the Selected Groups list on the right-hand pane.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune: Pick the group of employees that should get the policy
segment.target: Microsoft Intune: Pick the group of employees that should get the policy

segment.source: After you've picked all of the employees and groups that should get the policy, click OK.
segment.target: After you've picked all of the employees and groups that should get the policy, click OK.

segment.source: The policy is deployed to the selected users' devices.
segment.target: The policy is deployed to the selected users' devices.

segment.source: Link your EDP and VPN policies and deploy the custom configuration policy
segment.target: Link your EDP and VPN policies and deploy the custom configuration policy

segment.source: The final step to making your VPN configuration work with EDP, is to link your two policies together.
segment.target: The final step to making your VPN configuration work with EDP, is to link your two policies together.

segment.source: To do this, you must first create a custom configuration policy, setting it to use your EdpModeID setting, and then deploying the policy to the same group you deployed your EDP and VPN policies
segment.target: To do this, you must first create a custom configuration policy, setting it to use your EdpModeID setting, and then deploying the policy to the same group you deployed your EDP and VPN policies

segment.source: To link your VPN policy
segment.target: To link your VPN policy

segment.source: Open the Intune administration console, and go to the Policy node, and then click Add Policy.
segment.target: Open the Intune administration console, and go to the Policy node, and then click Add Policy.

segment.source: Go to Windows, click the Custom Configuration (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later), click Create and Deploy a Custom Policy, and then click Create Policy.
segment.target: Go to Windows, click the Custom Configuration (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later), click Create and Deploy a Custom Policy, and then click Create Policy.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune: Create a new policy from the New Policy screen
segment.target: Microsoft Intune: Create a new policy from the New Policy screen

segment.source: Type a name (required) and an optional description for your policy into the Name and Description boxes.
segment.target: Type a name (required) and an optional description for your policy into the Name and Description boxes.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune: Fill in the required Name and optional Description for your policy
segment.target: Microsoft Intune: Fill in the required Name and optional Description for your policy

segment.source: In the OMA-URI Settings area, click Add to add your EdpModeID info.
segment.target: In the OMA-URI Settings area, click Add to add your EdpModeID info.

segment.source: In the OMA-URI Settings area, type the following info:
segment.target: In the OMA-URI Settings area, type the following info:

segment.source: Setting name.
segment.target: Setting name.

segment.source: Type EdpModeID as the name.
segment.target: Type EdpModeID as the name.

segment.source: Data type.
segment.target: Data type.

segment.source: Pick the String data type.
segment.target: Pick the String data type.

segment.source: OMA-URI.
segment.target: OMA-URI.

segment.source: Type , replacing youredppolicyname with the name you gave to your EDP policy.
segment.target: Type , replacing youredppolicyname with the name you gave to your EDP policy.

segment.source: For example, .
segment.target: For example, .

segment.source: Value.
segment.target: Value.

segment.source: Your fully-qualified domain that should be used by the OMA-URI setting.
segment.target: Your fully-qualified domain that should be used by the OMA-URI setting.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune: Fill in the OMA-URI Settings for the EdpModeID setting
segment.target: Microsoft Intune: Fill in the OMA-URI Settings for the EdpModeID setting

segment.source: Click OK to save your new OMA-URI setting, and then click Save Policy.
segment.target: Click OK to save your new OMA-URI setting, and then click Save Policy.

segment.source: To deploy your linked policy
segment.target: To deploy your linked policy

segment.source: On the Configuration policies page, locate your newly-created policy, click to select it, and then click the Manage Deployment button.
segment.target: On the Configuration policies page, locate your newly-created policy, click to select it, and then click the Manage Deployment button.

segment.source: In the left pane of the Manage Deployment box, click the employees or groups that should get the policy, and then click Add.
segment.target: In the left pane of the Manage Deployment box, click the employees or groups that should get the policy, and then click Add.

segment.source: The added people move to the Selected Groups list on the right-hand pane.
segment.target: The added people move to the Selected Groups list on the right-hand pane.

segment.source: After you've picked all of the employees and groups that should get the policy, click OK.
segment.target: After you've picked all of the employees and groups that should get the policy, click OK.

segment.source: The policy is deployed to the selected users' devices.
segment.target: The policy is deployed to the selected users' devices.
